Tracklist:

01. Buddha, Joy of Man's Desiring {J.S. Bach: Jesus, Joy of Man's Desiring} - 3:44
02. "Hokushin-Itto-Ryu" Dance {Khachaturian: Sabre Dance} - 3:10
03. The "Samurai" Typewriter {Anderson: Typewriter} - 1:49
04. The Girl with the Black Hair {Debussy: The Girl with the Flaxen Hair} - 2:52
05. Japanese Dance No.5 {Brahms: Hungarian Dance No.5} - 3:30
06. Oitono Kirare - 5:20
07. "Ukiyoe" at an Exhibition {Mussorgsky: Pictures at an Exhibition} - 3:08
08. Wedding "Etenraku" March {Wagner/Mendelssohn: Wedding March; Trad.: Etenraku} - 4:33
09. La Tsugaru Jonganella {Paganini: La Campanella} - 2:22
10. Japanese Bolero {Ravel: Bolero} - 5:12
11. Yoake no Ato - 1:25
12. Csardas (Monti) - 4:29
13. Libertango (Piazzolla) - 2:48

Teppei Okada - violin
Tetsuro Sugiura - piano
Sho Asano - tsugaru-shamisen

Three samurai virtuoso musicians play western classical music in traditional Japanese music style.

A Japanese piano and violin duo "Sugi-Tetsu"(Tetsuro Sugiura & Teppei Okada) perform classical music with a humorous twist to it.
Sho Asano began playing shamisen at age five, influenced by his grandfather. At age seven, he made his first appearance at the All-Japan Tsugaru Shamisen Championship (Hirosaki), and became the youngest player ever to participate. 

Artist: Sugitetsu & Sho Asano
Title Of Album: Samurai Classical Music
Year Of Release: 2014
Label: Gis Label/GIS-0001
Genre: Classical Crossover, Japanese
Total Time: 44:20
